title: Conservation Perspectives: Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
title_display: Conservation Perspectives: Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
short_description: In this in-person conversation, Ashley Arico, assistant curator of ancient Egyptian art, and Rachel Sabino, director of Objects and Textiles Conservation, discuss the new installation Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt. They will share how they collaborated to prepare objects—many of which had not been on view for a decade or more—for display in the dynamic new gallery showcasing over 3,000 years of art from the ancient Nile Valley.
list_description: Join us in person to hear from curator Ashley Arico and conservator Rachel Sabino on the new installation Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt.
description:
In this in-person conversation, Ashley Arico, assistant curator of ancient Egyptian art, and Rachel Sabino, director of Objects and Textiles Conservation, discuss the new installation Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt. They will share how they collaborated to prepare objects—many of which had not been on view for a decade or more—for display in the dynamic new gallery showcasing over 3,000 years of art from the ancient Nile Valley. 

Please note that this is an in-person event that takes place at the museum.

In accordance with state and City of Chicago guidelines, visitors to the museum are no longer required to wear masks or provide proof of vaccination. Anyone who would like to continue to wear a mask is welcome to do so. Learn more about our visiting policies and what to expect.

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
